result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick W Phernetton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erick W Phernetton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erick W Phernetton was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
08/26/15 AMENDED TO INDICATE:   DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR CHALLENGE INCARCERATION PROGRAM. DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Any cash posted in either case 14CF104 or 14CF405 is to be applied to child support arrears. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain full time employment. 
Must seek work if unemployed or underemployed.

Must pay child support and arrears in full and on time each month and as ordered through WI SCTF. 
Must report any change of employment or address to the child support agency and the court within 72 hours thereof.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release and Huber privileges for work and work search. Court grants 22 days sentence credit.
